title: Discrepancy in hacker profile report count may reveal existence of a private program by publishing a report

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi team , @pei, @jobert , @bencode

**Summary:**
Again

We have publish report page
https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish

But we have bypass query #401476 this

***description***
The profile page counts the number of created your reports. But it does not consider the reports that are created in the sandbox. Thus, after creating the report, we can find out whether the external program is a private program or a sandbox.



### Steps To Reproduce

1. Use query in report #401476
2. {"query":"mutation Create_external_report_mutation($input_0:CreateExternalReportInput!,$types_1:[ErrorTypeEnum]!) {\\n createExternalReport(input:$input_0) {\\n clientMutationId,\\n ...F1,\\n ...F2\\n }\\n}\\nfragment F0 on Team {\\n id\\n}\\nfragment F1 on CreateExternalReportPayload {\\n team {\\n id,\\n ...F0\\n }\\n}\\nfragment F2 on CreateExternalReportPayload {\\n was_successful,\\n new_report {\\n node {\\n _id,\\n disclosed_at,\\n id\\n },\\n cursor\\n },\\n _errors2S3JlH:errors(types:$types_1) {\\n edges {\\n node {\\n type,\\n field,\\n message,\\n id\\n },\\n cursor\\n },\\n pageInfo {\\n hasNextPage,\\n hasPreviousPage\\n }\\n }\\n}","variables":{"input_0":{"handle":"`***any_external_handle***`","title":"afterDisabledButtonPublish","vulnerability_information":"tset","hacker_summary":"test","reported_date":"2018-08-25T04:29:37.081Z","resolved_date":"2018-08-25T04:29:37.081Z","attachment_ids":[336812],"clientMutationId":"0"},"types_1":"ARGUMENT"}}
3. Next go to your page 

For example my
https://hackerone.com/haxta4ok00

`129
Bugs found`
F346555

4. Go to try use query and write handle - ██████████
F346562
5. Go to profile and check "Bugs found" - `130`
F346556
6. Go to try use query @cisco and @apache
F346559
F346560
7. Go to profile and check "Bugs found" -130
F346557
8. Go to try write █████████
F346561
9. Check "Bugs found" -`131`
F346558

██████ , ███████ have private page.

If after creating a report, this will be credited to your profile. So this program has a private page

Sorry i bad speak english
I hope you understand me
Thank you,haxta4ok00

## Impact

disclosure of external programs with private
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi team , @pei, @jobert , @bencode

Summary:
Again

We have publish report page
https://hackerone.com/hacktivity/publish

But we have bypass query #401476 this

description
The profile page counts the number of created your reports. But it does not consider the reports that are created in the sandbox. Thus, after creating the report, we can find out whether the external program is a private program or a sandbox.

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Use query in report #401476
  2. {"query":"mutation Create_external_report_mutation($input_0:CreateExternalReportInput!,$types_1:[ErrorTypeEnum]!) {\n createExternalReport(input:$input_0) {\n clientMutationId,\n ...F1,\n ...F2\n }\n}\nfragment F0 on Team {\n id\n}\nfragment F1 on CreateExternalReportPayload {\n team {\n id,\n ...F0\n }\n}\nfragment F2 on CreateExternalReportPayload {\n was_successful,\n new_report {\n node {\n _id,\n disclosed_at,\n id\n },\n cursor\n },\n _errors2S3JlH:errors(types:$types_1) {\n edges {\n node {\n type,\n field,\n message,\n id\n },\n cursor\n },\n pageInfo {\n hasNextPage,\n hasPreviousPage\n }\n }\n}","variables":{"input_0":{"handle":"***any_external_handle***","title":"afterDisabledButtonPublish","vulnerability_information":"tset","hacker_summary":"test","reported_date":"2018-08-25T04:29:37.081Z","resolved_date":"2018-08-25T04:29:37.081Z","attachment_ids":[336812],"clientMutationId":"0"},"types_1":"ARGUMENT"}}
  3. Next go to your page

For example my
https://hackerone.com/haxta4ok00

129
Bugs found
129.png (F346555)

  1. Go to try use query and write handle - ██████████ F346562
  2. Go to profile and check "Bugs found" - 130 130.png (F346556)
  3. Go to try use query @cisco and @apache apache.png (F346559) cisco.png (F346560)
  4. Go to profile and check "Bugs found" -130 130After.png (F346557)
  5. Go to try write █████████ F346561
  6. Check "Bugs found" -131 131.png (F346558)

██████ , ███████ have private page.

If after creating a report, this will be credited to your profile. So this program has a private page

Sorry i bad speak english
I hope you understand me
Thank you,haxta4ok00

Impact

disclosure of external programs with private

additional_data.old_title: Credits "Found errors" after the publication of the report  will count the report if it was sent to an external program with a private page
additional_data.new_title: Discrepancy in hacker profile report count may reveal existence of a private program by publishing a report

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report and patience here! This looks like a valid security vulnerability. We'll get this checked out by an engineer and keep you posted throughout the process. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report and patience here! This looks like a valid security vulnerability. We'll get this checked out by an engineer and keep you posted throughout the process. Happy hacking!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert Thank you for the answer!
Sorry for question -- But why low severity, When I could discern the names of private programs, it was a medium.?
Thank you
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert Thank you for the answer!
Sorry for question -- But why low severity, When I could discern the names of private programs, it was a medium.?
Thank you

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - because it only seems to work for programs that have an external program, which not all of our programs have. This reduces the exploitability of the vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - because it only seems to work for programs that have an external program, which not all of our programs have. This reduces the exploitability of the vulnerability.

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- Again thank you for the answer.

But this is reports #342978 , #343464 They were also marked as finding private pages in external programs?

And you told me :

`Hi haxta4ok00 - thanks again for pointing out this security vulnerability. We've determined that the severity of this vulnerability is medium, which is why we're rewarding you with a $2,500 bounty. Even though the data itself isn't particularly sensitive, this issue can be used to` ***determine whether external programs in our Directory are running private programs. This was a good find, thanks!***

Thank you
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert -- Again thank you for the answer.

But this is reports #342978 , #343464 They were also marked as finding private pages in external programs?

And you told me :

Hi haxta4ok00 - thanks again for pointing out this security vulnerability. We've determined that the severity of this vulnerability is medium, which is why we're rewarding you with a $2,500 bounty. Even though the data itself isn't particularly sensitive, this issue can be used to determine whether external programs in our Directory are running private programs. This was a good find, thanks!

Thank you

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - you're right, my bad. I believed the attack complexity was high because it required us to approve the published report. However, this doesn't seem to be the case. I'll update the severity to reflect this. Thanks for pointing that out!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - you're right, my bad. I believed the attack complexity was high because it required us to approve the published report. However, this doesn't seem to be the case. I'll update the severity to reflect this. Thanks for pointing that out!

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - we're currently in the process of identifying all the different places where the existence of a private program can be leaked through this method. We have already identified a couple! In case you find any other places, please follow up in this ticket instead of filing a new report. We will work with you to appropriately reward you in case you've identified a place that we missed during root cause analysis. Thanks for your understanding!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - we're currently in the process of identifying all the different places where the existence of a private program can be leaked through this method. We have already identified a couple! In case you find any other places, please follow up in this ticket instead of filing a new report. We will work with you to appropriately reward you in case you've identified a place that we missed during root cause analysis. Thanks for your understanding!

activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert -- WoW! Thank you for a bounty! I am trying to find other methods, in case I will send you here, I understand you.!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert i think i found one more method

***description***
First, I want to point to the report #316718
It had an update field that could not always be set to > 0. Because not everyone has a record. Here I believe the same situation.

Since you asked me to write you here, I'm not creating a new report.

1)Create report(For the second situation) or create publish report

2)Create publish report for █████████ -- my number #412703 -- you can see this report ;)))))?

3)Next check endpoint --

https://hackerone.com/reports/412703/mediation_requests/unresponsive (GET)

Answer:

`{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,
"report":{"age":"about 19 hours"},"team":{"name":"████","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 months"}}`

We are see `"averageResolutionTime":"7 months"` external-sandbox haven't this parameter ? I am right?

2.1.1)Create report in private program and leave after
F349872
2.1.2)Closed self - N/A
F349873
2.1.3)Leaved program
F349874
2.1.4)Check endpoint

https://hackerone.com/reports/412978/mediation_requests/unresponsive

`{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,"report":{"age":"19 minutes"},"team":{"name":"███","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 days"}}`

We are see `"averageResolutionTime":"7 days"`

PS: There will be programs when you enable the option to show the average value of the resolution. But it will not work for sandboxes , because they will always have this field `-`. 
In the case of private pages, this will work when it is enabled. But again, I repeat that the report #316718 is the same situation. This must be enabled and there must be at least one record in the other report.
And at the end I see the value of the program parameter. Although it should not


I would call it the `Visibility of the time of the average state of resolution in external programs`
But I can't see this parameter anywhere?am I right?

What do you think for this?
Thanks

description
First, I want to point to the report #316718
It had an update field that could not always be set to > 0. Because not everyone has a record. Here I believe the same situation.

Since you asked me to write you here, I'm not creating a new report.

1)Create report(For the second situation) or create publish report

2)Create publish report for █████████ -- my number #412703 -- you can see this report ;)))))?

3)Next check endpoint --

https://hackerone.com/reports/412703/mediation_requests/unresponsive (GET)

Answer:

{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,
"report":{"age":"about 19 hours"},"team":{"name":"████","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 months"}}

We are see "averageResolutionTime":"7 months" external-sandbox haven't this parameter ? I am right?

2.1.1)Create report in private program and leave after
F349872
2.1.2)Closed self - N/A
F349873
2.1.3)Leaved program
F349874
2.1.4)Check endpoint

{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,"report":{"age":"19 minutes"},"team":{"name":"███","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 days"}}

We are see "averageResolutionTime":"7 days"

PS: There will be programs when you enable the option to show the average value of the resolution. But it will not work for sandboxes , because they will always have this field -.
In the case of private pages, this will work when it is enabled. But again, I repeat that the report #316718 is the same situation. This must be enabled and there must be at least one record in the other report.
And at the end I see the value of the program parameter. Although it should not

I would call it the Visibility of the time of the average state of resolution in external programs
But I can't see this parameter anywhere?am I right?

What do you think for this?
Thanks

activities.message:
Hey @jobert - i found and third part (͡๏̯͡๏) , ٩(◕‿◕)۶

1)http://hackerone.com/last-month
2) You will be redirect in twitter.
3) Example you will be see : `In August, I submitted 14 vulnerabilities to 6 programs on @Hacker0x01. #TogetherWeHitHarder https://hackerone.com/last-month`

4) If you send to an external program publish report and the number will increase, then you have found a private page 

5) Attention : When you create a report, in the date field, you need to specify the month that was before. In my case and on this moment this August (08/25/2018)

6)After ██████████ i have

`In August, I submitted 15 vulnerabilities to 6 programs on @Hacker0x01. #TogetherWeHitHarder https://hackerone.com/last-month`

6.1)After @cisco i have

`In August, I submitted 15 vulnerabilities to 6 programs on @Hacker0x01. #TogetherWeHitHarder https://hackerone.com/last-month`

6.2)After █████ i have 

`In August, I submitted 16 vulnerabilities to 6 programs on @Hacker0x01. #TogetherWeHitHarder https://hackerone.com/last-month`

Yes, it looks like the above part. But here is a very different calculation and I think it has nothing to do with the top
(https://hackerone.com/last-year)


Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- Thanks for the answer!,I want you to understand these points correctly.

1) Point profile: 
>count `Bugs found`, count `Thanks received` (was is fixed)

***Total : 2 parameters***

2) Point /last-year , I took a second account for a good show

https://hackerone.com/kaktaktoa/2017/9e4074d1e31187e0a6a7122f06348382
F358967

After create report for █████ ,changed the following parameters:

>`vulnerability`, `program`, `Resolved reports`, `used` ***count(bytes)***` 33 bytes to communicate their findings, most of which were written in October`, `The numbers don’t include the 1 untagged report.` (or ,after you change the Severity , it switches to the other parameter ) and `COMMON WEAKNESS ENUMERATION
Top weaknesses`

F358969
F358968
F358970
F358965
F358966

***Total : 7 parameters***

3) Point /last-month
>submitted 1 `vulnerability` to 1 `program`

***Total : 2 parameters***



All the parameters I wrote, all of them affect the disclosure. This post is more clarification for you on my part.  What to do with the parameter `mediation_requests/unresponsive` i don't know. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert -- Thanks for the answer!,I want you to understand these points correctly.

1) Point profile:

count Bugs found, count Thanks received (was is fixed)

2) Point /last-year , I took a second account for a good show

https://hackerone.com/kaktaktoa/2017/9e4074d1e31187e0a6a7122f06348382
clearAcc.png (F358967)

After create report for █████ ,changed the following parameters:

vulnerability, program, Resolved reports, used count(bytes)33 bytes to communicate their findings, most of which were written in October, The numbers don’t include the 1 untagged report. (or ,after you change the Severity , it switches to the other parameter ) and COMMON WEAKNESS ENUMERATION
Top weaknesses

FirstTwoParametrs.png (F358969)
SecondTwoParametrs.png (F358968)
ThirdOneParametrs.png (F358970)
4OneParametrsAfterChangeSeverity.png (F358965)
5OneParametrs.png (F358966)

Total : 7 parameters

3) Point /last-month

submitted 1 vulnerability to 1 program

Total : 2 parameters

All the parameters I wrote, all of them affect the disclosure. This post is more clarification for you on my part. What to do with the parameter mediation_requests/unresponsive i don't know. Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert --  I'm not sure you did the right thing.

Your engineers have made another case of opening a private program
After create publish report we have 2 state

1)If program have private page , we are will see title 
`You are participating in a private program for ████. Please do not publicly discuss the program until the program goes public.`
F380559

2)If program have not private page, title will be null
F380558

Let me know if I should have written this here, or created a separate report?
Thanks.

Hi @haxta4ok00 - 

> Let me know if I should have written this here, or created a separate report?

One of my colleagues confirmed that you're may be right! Can you file a new report for that so that we can investigate? We will treat it as a separate issue if it's a legitimate issue. Thanks!

> But this point https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/mediation_requests/unresponsive does not it let us know that the program has a private page with an external link, if we send the report through a publish report?

I'm not sure if I'm following. Can you elaborate what you mean exactly?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @haxta4ok00 -

Let me know if I should have written this here, or created a separate report?

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- I congratulate you and your team on the coming new year. I wish you happiness, health and good mood, Beautiful and creative reports !

I understand that you have already started the holidays, but still I will try my luck.

I would like to define this report and its cases this year.

1) The count in the profile -- was fixed
2) Points /last-year , /last-month -- You seem to have determined that these are legitimate case
3) Point `https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/mediation_requests/unresponsive` 
Example : https://hackerone.com/reports/452955/mediation_requests/unresponsive -- We have not discussed this case. :(
4) Point `https://hackerone.com/metrics?format=json`
And what should I do with this option, leave it here or create a new report? Since I am already confused with what is the main method in this report. Since you asked to write all the options with a similar method of finding private programs with an external link in this report, and not to create new ones. But, as practice has shown, you have considered the top message separately, and I received additional reputation for it.

I would like to hear it this year, so that the new year would begin even more actively.
Thanks and happy holidays! @haxta4ok00

1) Point `profile`: ***2 parameters*** -- `fixed` 
2) Point `/last-year` ***(old version)*** - ***/:username/2017/:hash/*** : **all parameters** - `fixed`
3) Point `/last-month` : ***all parameters*** - `fixed`

@bencode --
@Jobert:
we're currently in the process of identifying all the different places where the existence of a private program can be leaked through this method. We have already identified a couple! In case you find any other places, please follow up in this ticket instead of filing a new report. We will work with you to appropriately reward you in case you've identified a place that we missed during root cause analysis. Thanks for your understanding!

After first PoC , i give you 4 more PoC's

activities.message:
Hi @haxta4ok00 - 

Woah, that's a long thread, and took us some time to parse all the information here in the report. It does seem like you helped us identify more vulnerable endpoints that we missed in the original fix. Given that, we're happy to award a bonus for your continuing effort in looking into this. 

Thanks again, and happy hacking!
-Pei
